result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha L Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight-Time
Sentence credit of 16 days was granted.
Consecutive to: Count 1, 2, and 3 in case 20CM1340

Costs to be converted to a civil judgment. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

1:37 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing. Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Samantha L Johnson in court, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Samantha L Johnson.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and confirms with counsel they are prepared to proceed to plea and sentencing today.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Tapia confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2.  Court orders Count 1 dismissed and read in.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Tapia.
Defendant presents statements.
Court will award the defendant a total of 76 days credit between this case and 20CM1340.

COUNT 2:
The Court Orders the Following:
45 Days Jail Straight Time (16 Days Credit - Consecutive to Counts 1, 2 & 3 in 20CM1340)

COSTS: $243.00;
	
DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be converted to a civil judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:46 PM Defendant Samantha L Johnson in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.\

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Tapia is appointed.
Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

03:31 PM Defendant Samantha L Johnson in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The defendant is currently being represented by Attorney Ricardo Tapia on her underlying matter.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  The Court will set this matter back before the Commissioner for status of counsel on a date and time Attorney Tapia is available.  Hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
